title: Does HPUSBFW.exe have command line options?

forumNotes.author: pecd.net
forumNotes.content:
nightman uses "hpusbfw.exe -f" to format usb sticks (i believe the complete line is wrong)  

ShellExecute,Open,"%basedir%\\Temp\\%ProjectName%\\usb\\HPUSBFW.exe" -f,"#$qg:\\ #$q"  

should be (from WB help: ShellExecute,Action,"Filename","Parameters","StartDir")  

ShellExecute,Open,"%basedir%\\Temp\\%ProjectName%\\usb\\HPUSBFW.exe","-f"  

But i believe the -f is a leftover from pe2usb which uses this syntax. I could nowhere find proof that hpusbfw.exe accepts any commandline arguments...  

Does anyone know more about this or can anyone confirm that nightmans original line is wrong?   
Thanks.

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
From memory I cannot recall, but I do not think it uses command line options. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
But have you seen the newish batch by **fuwi** :  
[http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=21702](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=21702 "External link")  

It uses NOT HPUSBF**W** .EXE, but rather the HPUSBF.EXE, i.e. the command line version.  

jaclaz
